subject: RE: [junit] fork="no" unexpected behavior
msgSnippet: Is there any reason why you couldn t put them inside of the same  task? ... From: ktbarrett [mailto:ktbarrett@yahoo.com] Sent: Monday, October 07, 2002
messageBody:
Is there any reason why you couldn't put them inside of the same <junit>
task?

-----Original Message-----
From: ktbarrett [mailto:ktbarrett@...]
Sent: Monday, October 07, 2002 9:41 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] fork="no" unexpected behavior


I am trying to run more than one JUnit test from Ant which
shares
some static data through the VM. The following is an excerpt
from my
Ant script.

<target name="test">
<junit fork="no">
<test name="SupplierTest"/>
</junit>

<junit fork="no">
<test name="ConsumerTest"/>
</junit>
</target>

The problem is, the VM seems to fork whether I tell it too or
not. My
first test (SupplierTest) is creating some static objects, and
my
second test (ConsumerTest) is trying to use those objects. The
problem is that either Ant is creating a new VM or a new
ClassLoader
so my data is not available.

Any ideas?
